text: authorities have classified the South
Carolina Church attack as a hate crime
so what do we exactly know about hate
crimes in America the latest FBI
statistics are from 2013 when over 7,000
people were reported as victims of hate
crimes half of those people were
targeted because of their race the
biggest factor in hate crimes by far
next about 20 percent of people were
targeted because of their sexual
orientation other hate crimes involve
the victims religion like the 2012
shooting at a Sikh temple in Wisconsin
now in terms of racially motivated hate
crimes as the shooting in South Carolina
is believed to be a majority are
perpetrated because of anti-black bias
overall here are the top ways hate
crimes are committed acts of
intimidation destruction of property and
simple acts of assault only 10% of hate
crimes were classified as aggravated
assault like the shooting of the church
so who is committing these hate crimes
for cases where an offender's race was
reported over half were whites while
about 1/4 were black
he crimes in 2013 were down slightly
from the previous year but they're still
a major issue as we've seen in South
Carolina America is still confronting
the attitudes that drive hate David
Botti BBC News Washington
